Name: Old Man and the Whale
QuestDesc:
Sunshine, beach, ocean… and fish! Rinascita, surrounded entirely by the sea, thrives on its love for fishing. A young man named Ishmael will guide you to the Riccioli Islands, a fishing paradise like no other...
A sailor named Starbuck has fallen into mental turmoil—rumor has it, a fish drove him to this state...
Here, all fish gather—and since whales are also considered "fish", then...
A long-dead captain, a ship that cannot sail. Yet now, that captain has set upon an inevitable course, and the ship must sail once again...
In a storm long ago, a captain and a whale sank beneath the waves together. Now, a similar storm rages, and the whale roams the sea once more…
The sea has calmed, but Captain Ahab and his crew are gone. Ishmael, who first brought you to the Riccioli Islands, seems to be studying the relics left behind by the legendary captain…

Chapters.Title: Find the fisherman

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, call me Ishmael. Well, well! The Laureate, I presume? Have you ever tried fishing before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The trick to it is a flexible line and a subtle lure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fancy trying your hand at deep sea fishing? It's one of Rinascita's many lasting traditions, like the Carnevale.

Options.PlotLineKey: Sure, I want to become a pro angler.
I'd like to give it a try.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wonderful, then I've got a good place for you. Riccioli Islands, north of Ragunna. It's right where the currents of the Stormy Sea meet, drawing in swarms of fish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And if you're alone, angling on a fishing boat would suit you better. A net will just get you tangled up in trouble.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once you reach the islands, go visit an old captain called Ahab. He'll be more than glad to show you the ropes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've got to make my way back to the islands myself. There's a boat at the harbor that'll take you straight there. Just let the boatman know you're off for some fishing!

Chapters.Title: Find the Gondolier to prepare for the voyage to the Riccioli Islands

Dialogues.Speaker: Gondolier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you the one looking for a ride to Riccioli?

Options.PlotLineKey: I have other matters to attend to. Maybe later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gondolier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take a seat, and we'll be on our way!

Chapters.Title: Search for the old captain, "Ahab"

Dialogues.Speaker: Gondolier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seeking out old Ahab, are you? He should be at the harbor over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gondolier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's no ordinary man, I tell you that. You'll spot him a mile away.
Zzz... Zzz...
Huh? Hmm... All right, cut it out...
Oh! Ahoy! A fish! We have a bite!
Well, don't just stand there, {Male=laddie;Female=missy}! Gimme a hand with this thing!
Oh, wait! Easy does it...
That's gotta be one hefty fish...
A big fella like that? He won't be gettin' away from me, just a matter of time, no bother at all.
Oh, that? Pah, that was nothing. Back in me youth, I could hunt a whale for a whole day, I could!
You must be that young'un Ishmael mentioned.

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, I'm here to become a pro fisher.
Yes, I'm here to try deep sea fishing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye, good! You've come to the right place. The name's Ahab, and I've been tied to this harbor longer than most.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That octopus merchant over there is Planck. It has all you need, from fishing gear to boat repairs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... I see you don't have a boat. We can fix that! You can use mine!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The ones we use here for fishing are different from what you'll find in the city. We treat 'em like family—live and die together, we do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's called Rachel. Gettin' on in years, but she's still got some fire in her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since I retired, it's been a while since she and I crashed some waves. I reckon she misses the old fishing days as much as I do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, now that we've shared a bit of fishing, I'd say we've forged a bond, eh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you say we chase that big fella that gave us the slip? Let's head straight out to sea!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd like to see what kind of fish dares to run away from old Ahab!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With Ishmael's guidance, you manage to find the old captain, Ahab, at the dock. Ahab gladly lets you borrow his old Gondola, and you can go fishing at sea with it.

Chapters.Title: Speak with Planck and get ready to set sail
Speak to Planck to upgrade the ship's technology
With the fish back in the net, go chat with Ahab

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahoy! That was some mighty fine sailing back there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You picked it up quickly. Good, good！

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, don't forget to stop by the market when ye've got time to spare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Minding the helm is only half the battle. You've got to know how to trade, too!

Chapters.Title: Visit the market in Riccioli Port

Dialogues.Speaker: Seafood Dealer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Oi, the Order's got no authority here. Now, bugger off, will ya.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Fisherman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, Mr. Coffin. Didn't she just help you fix your Echo...

Dialogues.Speaker: Seafood Dealer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hell if I know what she's playin' at!

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Lady
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, pipe down, Coffin. The wee lassie was just asking you for some directions, for Imperator's sake.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry…

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm only looking for Cetus the Tidebreaker. They were injured in Ragunna…

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Lady
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cetus the Tidebreaker, you say? Well…

Dialogues.Speaker: Coffin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order is not welcome around these parts! Yer hear me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Fisherman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, look. Isn't that the Resonator who showed up in Ragunna a while back? The Laureate…

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's enough of that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order's left us alone for years. If they really wanted to meddle in our affairs now, you think they'd just send one little girl?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We owe our trade to the blessings of Cetus the Tidebreaker and these very seas. Ye're tellin' me we can't accept a wee lass in an Acolyte hat?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, do you really think she's helping you out for some devious reason? Being ungrateful isn't our way, is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Coffin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Ahab...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right then, that's enough of that. Business has been hard as it is lately. Break it up, folks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If ye've got more complaints, toss 'em my way. Happy now? Off you go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here because I want to talk to the villagers about the Tidebreaker. No one has seen them since the Carnevale...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Friend of yours, {Male=laddie;Female=missy}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All right, then. But know this—the Order's let these islands drift without a guide, so the folk around here aren't too keen on seeing someone wearin' that kind of hat wanderin' about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My hat? Err...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, just say ye're here on personal business and ye'll be fine. Now, I hear ye're lookin' for Cetus the Tidebreaker. Well, lucky you, 'cause so am I.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes! The Tidebreaker showed unnatural signs during the Carnevale not long ago. I think I sensed their pain and anger...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, sail around in these waters and ye're bound to run into it, sooner or later. But if you want the simple way... See that lighthouse down yonder?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are four of 'em across Riccioli Islands. As long as their lights are on, the Tidebreaker will answer our pleas as gently as ever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Three of them went dark when the Tidebreaker vanished. Getting them lit again should do the trick.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know what? Why don't you take Miss White Hat here on a wee boat ride, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A boat ride?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-what? I've only ever read about Riccioli Islands' fishing trade in the Order's library before, but I've never actually fished on the sea...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How do you expect the sea to answer yer calls if you don't embrace it yerself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and hold onto yer "hat" during the ride. If anything else comes up, just come find me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What did he mean by that, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I'll help however I can with catching fish while we locate the Tidebreaker!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After you've recaptured the escaped fish, Ahab suggests you check out the market. To your surprise, Phoebe is there too. You find her in a sticky situation because of the locals' fraught history with the Order of the Deep. After You and Ahab help her out, Phoebe reveals she came here searching for Cetus the Tidebreaker. Ahab remarks that you'll run into the beast eventually just by going out fishing.

Chapters.Title: Head to the dock and get ready to depart
Complete Requests to increase your Fame to Level 3 or above
Complete Requests or update the Index to increase your Fame to Level 3 or above
Search for Ahab near the dock in Riccioli Port

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My leg... Where's my leg... Fetch me the harpoon...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...First Mate... Oil... Where's my oil...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahoy. How did it go? Pull in a pretty big haul, did ye?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm gettin' closer to findin' the Tidebreaker meself. Just head over to the Helm Village and look for... What's his name again...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, right! Starbuck!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The man's lost a couple of his marbles these past few weeks. People say he only started actin' up after catchin' a glimpse of the Tidebreaker. Anyway, tell him I sent ye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also, notice that ship?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you want to catch yourself a real prize, ye'll be needin' that one. She's still waitin' on repairs, but the watermen can fill ye in on that.

Chapters.Title: Find a shipwright to learn more about the large ship

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, {PlayerName}? Ahab said of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bring me wood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wood. To fix ship.

Chapters.Title: Hand over logs and materials to Queequeg

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now not enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You bring material. Queequeg fix ship.

Chapters.Title: Go to the dock, prepare for departure, and travel to Helm Village
Travel to Helm Village
Search for Starbuck

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe... Oh, my sweet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one else knows. It's just between us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait for my return, my darling... fiancée...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Er, excuse me, sir? Are you the one who witnessed Cetus the Tidebreaker?

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? Yes, that's me! Are you here to witness our union? Marvelous! Come, according to tradition, a wedding witness must be present.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A wedding witness? Well, the Codex does allow Acolytes to serve as witnesses during weddings.

Options.PlotLineKey: What makes you want to marry a fish?!
He's certainly not acting like himself...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe... Hehehe...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is he... under some kind of enchantment? I've read of symptoms like this in the Order's archives before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O Imperator's blessings, gaze upon this...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-wait...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? I did what was written in the archives...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ouch!? You... I'm...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Golden white... Jellyfish... Pitch black... A large fish... Huh? You're human... I'm a fish... No wait... My fish...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ow, my head hurts... Who are you?

Options.PlotLineKey: Mind if I give him another smack?

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where the hell's my boat? And how did I get here... What?

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The fish... My, oh, my... From Serene Bay... The fish... Heeheehee...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's at it again! Here I go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? It's you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is your leg okay now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I treated their broken leg from a Gondola accident back at the market.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did... Mr. Coffin ask you to come here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think they're trying to say that Mr. Starbuck's Gondola might know something. They're stranded on a reef nearby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And Mr. Starbuck has been like this for two weeks now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You want us to use these to free the Gondola?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmmm, I fear Mr. Starbuck might not withstand any more of the Order's disenchantment tricks anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that brief moment when Mr. Starbuck seemed to recover, he mentioned his Gondola and a place called Serene Bay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Finding that boat and uncovering the cause behind his enchantment might be a good starting point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heehee... Yes, we must have fireworks at our wedding ... "Sweetened fireworks"...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Following Captain Ahab's instructions, you and Phoebe manage to find his old First Mate, Starbuck, but the man seems to have fallen under some kind of enchantment. To help Starbuck come to his senses, you decide to locate his Gondola for clues.

Chapters.Title: Set sail from the dock and find the abandoned gondola
Go to the location where the Gondola is trapped
Clear the rubble and free the Gondola

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Why is there a sweet scent in the air...？

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Gondola is drifting back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The rescued Gondola appears to be shouting something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You came across a "siren"? A creature with a human body and a fishtail?

Options.PlotLineKey: Isn't she supposed to be in Nimbus Sanctum?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could there be another being like Lorelei?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suspect that the fish we saw earlier is connected to this "siren."

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's got to be a reason it stayed fresh after all these weeks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This means we need to think of a way to get that fish out of Mr. Starbuck's hands.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's time for a little switcheroo.
We catch one that looks similar and call it a day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would that work?

Options.PlotLineKey: We're running low on options here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, only one way to find out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Phoebe find Starbuck's lost Gondola. Having theorized that Starbuck's enchantment has something to do with the fish he was holding, the two of you begin brainstorming a plan to get it off his hands.

Chapters.Title: Complete Requests or update the Index to increase your Fame to Level 6 or above
Complete Requests or update the Index to increase your Fame to Level 6 or above
Set sail and complete all Priority Requests
Completed all Priority Requests
Set sail and catch big fish for trading
Wait for the evening (or adjust the time to 19:00-05:00)
Fish for large catches at designated Fishing Spot

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A large dark gray fish flies onto your boat...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It does look similar to the fish Starbuck is holding. Maybe you can swap the fish in Starbuck's hands with this one.

Chapters.Title: Head back to Helm Village and find Starbuck

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehehe...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? My dear witness, have you seen my fiancée around?

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehehe... You… What are you up to?

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Help! Somebody help!!!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phoebe! Grab its tail!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-It's so slippery! Disenchant!

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thieves! You filthy thieves!

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... You... My head...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who are you? What am I doing with this fish?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Starbuck? Captain Ahab asked us to come find you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Old Ahab? Wait, what's going on here?

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you know anything about this blue fish?
Do you remember what happened to Cetus the Tidebreaker?

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All I remember is being out at sea fishing not long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But all I could hear was a song, drawing me in. It felt like my whole body was being beckoned to follow that tune.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The next thing I knew, I was drifting right out of Serene Bay, where the Tidebreaker is said to slumber.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The singing was still there, like it was rising from the depths. I swear I caught a glimpse of the Cetus's shadow... then another shadow of a massive fish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, the curves of that shadow. A true beauty...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tossed everything I had into the sea, anything that could serve as bait, but still, it wouldn't bite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, I felt a tug on the line as the singing grew louder... and everything went blank after that.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you catch this blue fish?

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes! That's the one!

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, wait! Where is it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Key! The key... Blast it, where'd that key go?

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The key... I used it as bait...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Starbuck reaches inside the blue fish and pulls out a key…

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aha! I knew it! Molto bene! Got gobbled up by the fish!

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Old Ahab had me keep it. You'll be needing it too, yes?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A key covered in rust. Seems like it's seen better days...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't recall much after that, but no doubt the Tidebreaker did make an appearance in Serene Bay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're looking for it, go take a look around the bay. Oh, and thanks for the help...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm forty-seven years old this year. After all these years at sea, I've caught more fish than you can imagine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the right fish and the right person have yet to cross my path.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, but this beautiful lady here—

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Farewell, Mr. Starbuck.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish you the best! May Imper... May the sea bring you blessings!

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh, right... Okay then...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Phoebe finally manage to grab the fish from Starbuck, and the First Mate's sanity is restored. Starbuck claims he once saw Cetus the Tidebreaker at a place called Serene Bay, with a large fish swimming alongside it. He hands you the lighthouse key Captain Ahab entrusted in his care before you departed.

Chapters.Title: Use the key to light up the lighthouse in Helm Village

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's light up the lighthouses on this island as Captain Ahab instructed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After that, we should go visit that Serene Bay Mr. Starbuck talked about.

Chapters.Title: You have obtained the ship blueprint. Go ask Queequeg about ship repairs

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The once wreckage is starting look more like a ship now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ship almost fixed up. Thank you. Only half to go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain's orders. Almost working.

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As long ship is repaired, will be fine. All will be fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, that big "fish." Serene Bay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We failed before. You be careful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tidebreaker knocks over your boat, and you're washed ashore by the heavy waves...

Chapters.Title: Prepare for departure at the dock and head to Serene Bay
Travel to Serene Bay
Defeat the Tacet Discords

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phoebe!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Get out of the way!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}! Are you hurt?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tidebreaker attacked us! Thank Imperator none of us were hurt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Quick, let's check if anything was lost!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You check your belongings...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find a bizarre fish, its color all wrong, and its eyes glow with an unsettling shimmer.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing's lost, except now we've got this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a strange fish...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about we take it to Planck? Maybe it knows what this is.

Chapters.Title: Find the dock in Serene Bay and ask Planck for details

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The octopus Echo waves its tentacles around as it hands you a note from Ahab.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Once it's safe, Planck can swim over to Serene Bay."

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Since the lighthouse on Starbuck's island is up and running, we can set sail again. We're counting on you and Miss White Hat."

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "There'll be monsters swarming in those waters, ever since Cetus went missing."

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Word is, the key to Serene Bay's lighthouse got lost long ago. We only know it's somewhere at the bottom of the sea."

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Oh, I reckon you'll be greeted by a few strange fish along the way."

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "I'll keep poking around and see what else I can dig up. I'll have Planck send word once I've got news."

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are rocks in the way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, we can clear it with Echo skills!

Chapters.Title: Complete Planck's mission request
Complete Requests to increase your Fame to Level 9 or above
Complete Requests or update the Index to increase your Fame to Level 9 or above
Set sail and catch Titanium Mackerel at the given location
Light up the lighthouse in Serene Bay

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}! Look, it's the Tidebreaker!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're heading towards that island to the west!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their wounds seem to be healing, but I still feel the intense fury in their cries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tidebreaker has indeed been wandering in Serene Bay. After the lighthouse was relit, the beast swam towards a small island covered in storm...

Chapters.Title: Got the new ship blueprint. Go deliver it to Queequeg at the shipyard

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The ship repairs look almost complete.

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The ship is fixed. Thank you. It is time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pequod, needs a captain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Queequeg
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Ahab not captain anymore, then... we still need a captain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ship getting better. Ahab lost his harpoon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahab says, once ship is repaired, we can all go home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahab is captain. He is right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pequod is ready, Ahab.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can bring us all home, Ahab.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go home. Home...

Chapters.Title: Find Ahab and learn about the final island

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm gettin' old... Starbuck... old...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let it take out the Albatross... This time I'll...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, you're here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That island Tidebreaker ran off to is also known as Reyes Ruins. They say it's filled with old mysteries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The storm ragin' over it seems to keep folks from settin' foot there. Its own protection, if ye will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But not to worry, I've already found a way to get past it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Starbuck isn't pullin' my leg, that storm and the siren are in cahoots. Which means...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, let's move out! You and Miss White Hat will team up, and I'll be with Starbuck.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's a wee island just east of the ruins. We'll meet there.

Chapters.Title: Sail from the dock to the small island designated by Ahab
Sail from the dock to the small island designated by Ahab

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see, Captain. What did I tell you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It says here, "Riccioli, shower Neptunia with your light. The usurper slumbers in the depths of Reyes. Offer your love to Reyes' descendants and the eternal life of the sea."

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's all this nonsense?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Riccioli corresponds to Neptunia in Rinascitan astrology. In other words, the island is surrounded by the deepest waters in all of Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ho, ho. You know your astrology well, Miss White Hat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just stating what everyone in Rinascita knows. It's also mentioned in the legends of the Sentinel Imperator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I'm not sure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Offer your love..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So it's asking us to fall in love with somethin'? That's just plain odd!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bleh.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O great, noble descendants of Reyes, hear my words! I offer ye me love!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Umm... I shall offer ye my love! The ceaseless waves shall be my pledge of loyalty to you for all eternity!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bah, I'm gettin' too old for this! What dunderheaded idea is this, anyway!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go on, {Male=laddie;Female=missy}. You give it a go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye, you. Just a few words, for the love of the sea! What, need a pen and paper, do ye?

Options.PlotLineKey: O great, noble descendants of Reyes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, no, no! You're all doing it wrong!

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you take love for? Is this a joke to you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Step aside!

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My love. You are the light of my life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No storm can keep us apart, for in your presence, the might of my love can withstand any tempest, for it is even stronger!

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My soul yearns to break free, for it has found its direction, yet I am tormented by my inability to reach you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's working! It's working!

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, my dearest love—

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's enough of that! Let's move out! We've got no time to dawdle!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you find it impossible to pass through the storm looming over Reyes Islands, you head towards the nameless island Ahab mentioned. You attempt to dispel the storm following the inscription on the ancient steles, but to no avail. In the end, it's Starbuck's peculiar method of "offering his love" to the island that finally calms the storm.

Chapters.Title: Discuss the island with Phoebe and begin the investigation

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, have you noticed that something doesn't feel right about Captain Ahab?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't say what it is for certain... But I just have a feeling that he's hiding something from us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why don't we split up the search?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If there's a connection between this island and Tidebreaker, I'm sure we'll find something, especially with all the scattered ruins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can decipher these ancient Rinascitan texts. We'll have the truth soon enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It says here that the key to the lighthouse among the ruins is sealed within the treasure of this island.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps it's over there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Splendid! Now that we got rid of that storm, Planck can swim over here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can't say the same for Queequeg, though. The repaired Pequod is awaitin' her new captain before she can set sail.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's take a look around. Don't know much about the lighthouse here in Reyes, but I'll have that siren hangin' from the tip of me mast by day's end, ye mark me words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You did well back there, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not everyone can survive the weight of the sea. She's a merciful mistress, but she can be merciless, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even in dreams, I see meself hurlin' sharp harpoons into the water. They must sink deep before they strike with true power and precision.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though we are blessed by the sea, we stand ready to point our harpoons at it... and at that fella.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strife, chaos... endless conflict. This is the fate of those who live with the tides.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How nice... Did you know? Some people die at the tide's ebb, some at low water...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some at the full of the flood. And I'm just a billow that kisses the storm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go, Captain. Do what you must and whatever your heart desires.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh. Hello...

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, actually, I should thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it weren't for you, I wouldn't have gotten this far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... Captain Ahab has his own ambitions. So do I.

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Sign* My beloved. Wait for me, will you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But then again, not too late is it, even now, to desist... Behold!

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahab, you old fool! It seeks you not! It is you, you, that madly seeks him!

Chapters.Title: Find clues around the lighthouse

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Present the trinity gifts of the sea, and thus the light shall burn eternally."

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this means... we need to find three "gifts" from the sea to break this seal?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where the Reverberations converge. May they rest in peace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My love!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha! Hold on tight!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fight till the end, Pequod!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let us venture into the abyss!

Chapters.Title: Set sail to seek the "Gift" hidden in the ocean
Quest_880000038_ChildQuestTip_880_27
Quest_880000038_ChildQuestTip_880_39
Deliver the catch to the first location
Solve the first ghost's riddle
Quest_880000038_ChildQuestTip_880_54
Quest_880000038_ChildQuestTip_880_56
Deliver the catch to the second location
Solve the second ghost's riddle
Quest_880000038_ChildQuestTip_880_61
Deliver the catch to the third location
Solve the third ghost's riddle

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mysterious spirit seems to have enjoyed the fish and leaves feeling very much satisfied...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mysterious spirit appears to have heard the callings of the sea and faded away...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mysterious spirit gazes towards the last lighthouse, as if hoping it will shine once again...

Chapters.Title: Light up the lighthouse on Reyes Island
Find Phoebe and exchange the gathered clues

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We managed to get all four lighthouses lit again, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you hear the Tidebreaker's cries? They don't sound as sad, hurt, and angry as they did before.

Options.PlotLineKey: The whale's cries do sound very emotional.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've managed to decode inscriptions from a few stone tablets I found inside the ruins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cetus the Tidebreaker... is deeply connected to the Sentinel Imperator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the last lighthouse becomes operational once more, Cetus the Tidebreaker returns to its usual gentle self. Meanwhile, Phoebe has also made progress in her investigation of the island.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In legends

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cetus the Tidebreaker guides drowned ships and sailors

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To the realm beyond

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet they were fickle

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When they sang in sorrow and fury

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tempests raged

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Skies darkened

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until Imperator enlightened them with lantern light

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Making them a ruler of marine life

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And Guardian of the Sea

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some of these ancient stone tablets tell of tales from long before the Order ever existed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides Cetus the Tidebreaker, I've also found information about the "siren" that might have enchanted Mr. Starbuck.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a Remnant Creature that dwells in the depths of Riccioli. It may even be the same kind as Lorelei, who we met in the Nimbus Sanctum.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Tidebreaker absent, the restless Reverberations of the departed likely accumulated in her body. Those lost souls were coaxing her to enchant the fishermen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She and the Tidebreaker share a symbiotic relationship. However, she is still weak, not quite as fully formed as Lorelei.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe she was the one mending Tidebreaker's wounds...

Options.PlotLineKey: We need to get her back to normal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time to put our experience in the Nimbus Sanctum to good use. I'm certain we can make it work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's just...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, do you happen to speak the whale's language?

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe Abby can communicate with it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd like to sit down and have a nice chat with Tidebreaker once this is all over.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But for now, let's make our way to find Captain Ahab.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After deciphering the ancient tablets, Phoebe believes the Tidebreaker is tasked to guide the lost souls to the realm beyond, and the "siren" invading these waters may be a creature similar in nature to Lorelei. With the information at hand, the two of you seek Captain Ahab's aid to deal with the "siren."

Chapters.Title: Find Ahab
Examine the note left behind by Ahab

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab's Note
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Damn you, you cold-blooded beast I've struggled so much to conquer...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab's Note
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've gone old, and the curse you laid upon me ends today... But I will fight you till the very end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab's Note
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll run you down, come hell or high water!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab's Note
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O waves, unleash your fury upon me! Increase your might to the storm that carries me to my coming doom!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab's Note
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Men of Pequod! Our promised rest is nigh!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab's Note
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The whirlpools that once claimed my life, and the tempest that once filled my sails, I now call upon you! And that beast as well!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ahab's Note
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come! Let us sever these bonds that bind us as we dive into the abyss to embrace our fate!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}! You have returned!

Options.PlotLineKey: Where's Captain Ahab and the others?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I overheard that the Pequod was ready to sail, so I headed over to take a look.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But by the time I arrived, the beach was empty, and I only found Planck over there.
Well, if it isn't my First Mate, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is quite the ship you've got here. Looks like it's seen better days though.

Options.PlotLineKey: I pieced that ship together, plank by plank!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems you've grown a strong connection with it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A few days ago, Ahab summoned me to take helm of this fine vessel…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To be honest, I haven't the slightest clue. By the way, where are you now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that your Gondola that's sailing away into the waves?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello! Yoo-hoo!
I'm coming to see you, my love!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's Starbuck!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The scoundrel's hightailing with the boat!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You there! Stop!

Dialogues.Speaker: Starbuck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The might of my love can withstand any tempest, for it is ever stronger!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's... He's heading straight into the storm! After him! The man's lost it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Planck
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bloop...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Planck seems frightened by something. Guess the shop's closed for business for now...

Chapters.Title: Meet Brant aboard "Pequod" to set sail

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This ship doesn't seem to require a full crew to operate. A captain will suffice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All set and ready for sail?

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did the lines tighten by themselves?

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Make ready for cast off!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It appears that Pequod wasn't able to escape its fate after all...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alas, my duty as acting captain has been fulfilled. Farewell, my friends!

Chapters.Title: Wait for Phoebe to recover. Adjust the time to between 4:00 and 9:00
Go investigate Cetus the Tidebreakder near Reyes Island

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tidebreaker...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, hey, big guy! Nice to see you again!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still remember when you flipped over our boat last time, you know. But considering you just saved us, I'll call it even! Hmph... Like the old Jinzhou saying, something like "Big folks let little things slide!"

Options.PlotLineKey: It's obviously way bigger than you are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The big guy says that "siren" helped care for its wounds, but then she went cuckoo after sucking in too many Reverberations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why it didn't want to fight her earlier. After teaching her a lesson, maybe she'll know better.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tidebreaker. I... I have something to ask you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you fully recovered?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course it is! Look at it live and kicking. It's never been better.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You were tricked and deceived during the Carnevale... I know that an Acolyte like me is in no position to represent the Order...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I still wish to offer you an apology, Cetus the Tidebreaker, even if it's only my own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It says don't beat yourself up over it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've been following its trail all this time, helping fishermen and receiving gifts of the sea yourself. It's trying to protect that stuff, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! It also wants me to tell you great job on catching that big fish earlier!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Just be yourself, whether it's giving or receiving, belief or hope," it says.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Thank you for telling me that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure we are! Nothing stands in our way when we tag team!

Options.PlotLineKey: What if one day I manage...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uhh, what's up, big fella? Cat got your tongue?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are they... laughing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa!!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-W-Where do you think you're goin'? Oh, I'm so catching that whale someday. Just you wait and see!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the storm subsides, you meet the Tidebreaker again after it carried you back from the depths of the sea. Phoebe wishes to express her apology to the beast for what happened during the Carnevale, but the Tidebreaker holds no grudge. Maybe one day in the future, as a pro angler, you might be able to reel the big guy in...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Gondola loaded with cargo seems to be saying, "Give me money and I'll give you goodies!"

Chapters.Title: Complete Requests or update the Index to increase your Fame to Level 10 or above
Find Ishmael in Riccioli Port

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wonder if you've noticed, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After you set the Tidebreaker and the sea right again, Captain Ahab, Mr. Starbuck, and Mr. Queequeg all disappeared...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm currently going over Captain Ahab's old journal, and it seems like they were searching for this "final harbor."

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain Ahab spent his whole life on the waves. He was the finest captain and fisherman this place ever saw.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we steer our course by Ahab's example, we might discover things, even treasures he left behind...

Options.PlotLineKey: Can we catch Cetus the Tidebreaker?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a possibility. Captain Ahab always had an obsession with the Cetus, but why remains a mystery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well then, let's press on with this as our goal!

Chapters.Title: Complete Requests or update the Index to increase your Fame to Level 12 or above
Find Ishmael in Riccioli Port

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The sea feels ever so calm, and the whirlpools have finally settled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything's returned to how it once was… To be honest, {PlayerName}, Captain Ahab and his crew met their fate at sea decades ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their love of the sea and their promise to Cetus the Tidebreaker is what kept their spirits lingering here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now, the peaceful waters of Riccioli mark their final resting place. This is their "final harbor."

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the Rachel still sails on, and it seems to have taken a liking to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe that Captain Ahab also hoped you'd carry on his legacy...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me? I'm just a simple sailor and fisherman. I was born here, and I'll probably get married and have children here too. Eventually, I'll find my peace in these very waters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ishmael
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So set sail, Captain {PlayerName}! Your journey leads to the very edge of the world.
